intro: Dalechampia caperonioides var. genuina, commonly known as the Mexican horse chestnut, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-green bracts. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a silky, white coating. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in suitable regions.
